business.headline: Sensex jumps 600 points. Why is stock market rising today?Stock market today: While volatility on Dalal Street rose during the trading session, gains in major shares such as Kotak Mahindra Bank, Wipro, Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv, SBI and Reliance Industries contributed to the market gains.

Paytm Q3 FY25 results: Revenue surges to Rs 1,828 crore, gets closer to profitabilityThe growth was propelled by the company's robust payments business and an expanding portfolio in financial services distribution.

Bankrupt airline Go First's liquidation plea approved by law tribunalGo First's lenders decided to liquidate the bankrupt budget carrier's assets in August of last year after rejecting bids by interest suitors.
Explained: Why Vodafone Idea share price surged 15% todayVodafone Idea stock: The shares hit the day's high of Rs 10.48, rising close to 15% after it closed at Rs 9.12 in the previous session. 10.03

UK's richest 10% took half of colonial India's wealth: ReportA report mentioned that colonialism was responsible for ruining Indian industrial output by imposing strict protectionist policies which prevented Asian textiles from competing in the global market.
Paytm share price gains after reporting Q3 results. Check details herePaytm shares were up 1.44% to Rs 912.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:25 am.

Kotak Mahindra Bank share price up 10% after Q3 results. Buy, hold or sell?Kotak Mahindra Bank stock price: The private lender's shares have got several upgrades from brokerage firms following its strong third-quarter performance.

Laxmi Dental IPO listing: Shares open at 23% premium on D-Street. Hold or sell?  Laxmi Dental stock price: The shares of Laxmi Dental opened at Rs 528 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) reflecting a gain of 23.36% over its IPO price.
Sensex, Nifty open higher boosted by banking stocks. Kotak Bank gains 10%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 168.02 points to 76,787.35, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 31.55 points to 23,234.75 as of 10 AM.

Laxmi Dental IPO listing: Shares to make strong market debut? Check GMP Laxmi Dental IPO saw bumper subscription numbers as investors flocked to bid for the public issue. The IPO received bids over 100 times.

EPFO simplifies fund transfers, personal detail corrections for membersWith the introduction of the revised process, it is expected that in future over 1.20 crore out of 1.30 crore total transfer claims would be directly forwarded to EPFO without requiring the employer's intervention.

Stocks to watch today: Wipro, Zomato, Paytm, IDBI Bank, Adani Enery In today's trading session, stocks of Zomato, Paytm, IDBI Bank will be in the spotlight as they will announce their Q3 FY25 results today. Wipro shares will also be in the focus as it reported a rise in consolidated net profit in Q3 earnings.

Hindenburg's Nate Anderson could be charged with securities fraud: ReportAnderson is under scrutiny for colluding with hedge funds in preparing reports to target various companies, added the report based on a Canadian portal, which cited documents filed before a court in Ontario.

Trump 2.0: What the new US President means for Indian stock marketsBack in November, news of Donald Trump's return to the White House sent the Sensex soaring by over 900 points, sparking optimism across Dalal Street.

Donald Trump launches $TRUMP meme coin, crypto traders make millions in minutesDonald Trump, days before his presidential inauguration, shook the crypto market with the launch of $TRUMP meme coin, which surged 220 per cent in value and hit USD 4.25 billion in hours.
IMF forecasts India's growth at 6.5% for fiscal year 2025-2026IMF maintains India's growth at 7% for 2024-2025 and 6.5% for 2025-2026, driven by investment and consumption.

8th Pay Commission: What were the big changes in 7th and 6th Pay Commissions?The Government has approved the formation of the 8th Pay Commission for central government employees and pensioners. Here is a look at the salary hikes under the 7th and 6th Pay Commissions.

5 simple tips to get personal loans at lowest interest ratesThis article guides you through five effective strategies to secure personal loans at the most competitive interest rates, ensuring you make informed financial decisions and reduce your overall borrowing costs.

Why 8th Pay Commission is spurring calls for income tax relief in BudgetWith government employees set to benefit from a pay hike from the 8th Pay Commission, private sector employees are demanding income tax relief to boost their disposable income. Experts argue that easing the tax burden on individuals is key to spurring consumption, the backbone of India's economic growth.
Sensex ends over 400 points lower, Nifty falls as IT stocks tumbleThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 423.49 points lower at the closing bell, whil the NSE Nifty50 settled 108.60 points lower at 23,203.20.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Rarest of rare case, says CBI, demands death penalty for RG Kar case convictKolkata rape-murder convict Sanjay Roy claimed his innocence before the court on Monday when the judge asked if he had anything to say regarding the quantum of punishment.

Trump vows to prevent World War III, invasion of US borders before oathUS President-elect Donald Trump promised to hit the ground running when he takes office on Monday and said he would prevent World War III and stop the "invasion" of the country's borders.

Kerala woman, 24, sentenced to death for 2022 murder of boyfriend Sharon RajGreeshma, who was found guilty of murdering Sharon Raj by poisoning him in October 2022, was sentenced to death by a district sessions court in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. Her uncle was sentenced to three years in jail for destroying evidence.

26-year-old Hyderabad man shot dead in Washington, US A 26-year-old Hyderabad youth was shot dead by unidentified assailants in the United States. The incident occurred on Washington Avenue, where the victim, Raviteja was reportedly attacked by miscreants.

Ground report: Indian community members congratulate Trump, hope for stronger tiesMembers of the Indian community have congratulated Donald Trump ahead of his swearing-in as the 47th President of the United States on Monday, expressing hope that US-India relations would continue to flourish under the new administration. Speaking to India Today's Anjana Om Kashyap and Gaurav Sawant, people of the Indian community said that they expect US-India relations to continue flourishing amid the new political climate in America. 78-year-old Donald Trump succeeds Joe Biden, 82, on Tuesday as the new occupant of the White House. External Affairs Ministr S Jaishankar wil represnt India at the swearing-in ceremony of Donald Trump.

Australian broadcaster says Djokovic comments were banter, apologises on airAustralian broadcaster Tony Jones has apologised to Novak Djokovic and his fans after the legendary player refused to give a post-match interview after his fourth round fixture in the Australian Open 2025.

Delhi fighting confusion, not pollution, this winterFrequent imposition of crippling Grap restrictions without any formal communication has left Delhi NCR residents scrambling. Not only has it hit the livelihood of the poor, hefty traffic fines of Rs 20,000 have sown chaos in Delhi-NCR even as pollution persists this winter.

Rohit Sharma's Champions Trophy gesture at Wankhede Stadium ceremony goes viral Champions Trophy 2025: Rohit Sharma posed with the coveted trophy along with the doyens of Mumbai cricket, including Sunil Gavaskar and Sachin Tendulkar, during the celebration of the 50th anniversary of the Wankhede Stadium on Sunday, January 19.

40 years apart, Trump and Reagan's inauguration have one thing in commonRonald Reagan became the oldest President to take office at the age of 73. In 2021, outgoing President Joe Biden broke the record at the age of 78 years, And now Trump, who turned 78 in June 2024, will become the oldest person to start a presidential term.

Mohammed Siraj in, Ravindra Jadeja out for Champions Trophy: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra believes India's Champions Trophy squad missed a trick by excluding Mohammed Siraj, suggesting his inclusion could have bolstered the pace attack at the expense of Ravindra Jadeja.

Supreme Court halts criminal proceedings against Rahul Gandhi in defamation caseThe Supreme Court halted criminal proceedings against Rahul Gandhi in a defamation case filed against him for his statements about Home Minister Amit Shah.

Gael is also Monflis is in action vs Ben Shelton at Margaret Court Arena. On the other hand, Elena Rybakina got knocked out after losing against Madison Keys. Earlier, Elina Svitolina beat Veronika Kudermetova in straight sets to progress to the quarter-finals.

Man proposes to girlfriend at Coldplay's Mumbai concert. Watch their dreamy momentA woman who attended Coldplay's concert in Mumbai over the weekend had an unforgettable experience when her boyfriend proposed to her in front of the entire audience.

Saif Ali Khan attack case: Two lawyers clash in court over representing accusedSaif Ali Khan Attack: Two lawyers argued in a Mumbai court over representing the man accused of stabbing actor Saif Ali Khan in his Bandra apartment.

Watch: Moment Elon Musk's son X followed him on stage at Trump's pre-oath rallyA video of X Æ A-Xii running up to his father on the stage has delighted the internet as Elon Musk exclaimed: "Sorry, little X just followed me on the stage here. He is a very enthusiastic supporter as you can see."

Is India facing an obesity crisis?The commercialisation of junk food, increase in inactive lifestyles with prolonged sitting, and high stress environments, have caused obesity rates to rise in India, mirroring a global trend.

Donald Trump to take oath as 47th US President today, S Jaishankar to attend event Live UpdatesDonald Trump will be inaugurated as the 47th US President today in a star-studded event that will be attended by a galaxy of foreign dignitaries, including External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, and a host of business magnates.

As Sweden shifts back to books, is India next in the digital learning struggle?Sweden is bringing back textbooks to its curriculum after realising the digital-first approach has fallen short in developing fundamental skills like reading and writing. Can Indian schools face a similar problem?

Trump left Oval Office letter for Biden. Now, it's his turn in a unique firstBiden will be writing a letter to Trump in what would be a first in the 35-year-old tradition -- penning a note for his successor, Trump, who had left a letter for him as a predecessor in 2020.

Held hostage by H-1B visa system, Indians show signs of depression, anxietyFrom signs of depression and anxiety to not being able to visit their parents, some Indian H-1B visa holders took to social media to discuss how their lives have been hit by uncertainties. They might have to deal with the impact of H-1B visa curbs after US President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration on January 20.

Kannappa: Akshay Kumar poses with trishul and damru as Lord Shiva in first lookActor Akshay Kumar appears as Lord Shiva in Vishnu Manchu's pan-India mythological film, Kannappa. The actor exudes power and strength in his first look as a Hindu deity.

Jackie Chan teams up with SEVENTEEN's Jun for upcoming film The Shadow's EdgeJackie Chan has joined forces with SEVENTEEN's Jun in the upcoming film, The Shadow's Edge. The film will mark Jun's return to the big screen.

Manoj Bajpayee rejoices as fans celebrate Satya re-release with danceManoj Bajpayee shared a video on X featuring fans celebrating the re-release of his film Satya in theatres. Alongside the clip, he also expressed gratitude and called the film a 'timeless masterpiece'.

Akshay Kumar reveals his favourite patriotic film. Hint: It stars Raaj KumarBollywood star Akshay Kumar recently disclosed his favourite patriotic film. The movie, which was released during the 1971 war, starred Raaj Kumar in the lead.

Oscar-nominated director Shaunak Sen on cancer battle: Utter bolt from the blueIn a shocking revelation made on Instagram, filmmaker Shaunak Sen shared his cancer diagnosis and subsequent surgery details.

sports.headline: Nigeria script history after beating New Zealand in U-19 World CupNigeria created history by defeating New Zealand in the ICC Women's U19 T20 World Cup, securing their first-ever victory. Despite rain-curtailed conditions and a modest total, Nigeria's disciplined bowling and exceptional fielding sealed a thrilling two-run win.

Premier League: Man United slip again as Brighton complete Old Trafford hat-trickPremier League 2024-25: Manchester United conceded two second-half goals to slip to a 1-3 defeat to Brighton on Sunday at home. The Old Trafford club is at the 13th spot with 26 points from 22 matches in the season.

Double delight: India men and women's teams clinch Kho Kho World Cup crownsIndia men and women's teams won the inaugural edition of the Kho Kho World Cup in New Delhi on Sunday. The men's team outclassed Nepal in a thrilling final after the one-sided women's final between the two nations.

Bound by love: Neeraj Chopra gets married in dreamy ceremony, shares photosOlympic medalist Neeraj Chopra tied the knot with his partner, Himani Mor, in a dreamy private ceremony. The javelin superstar shared photos from the wedding on social media on Sunday, January 19.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
